title: Allspice
summary: Allspice, also known as Jamaica pepper, myrtle pepper, pimenta, or pimento,[lower-alpha 1] is the dried unripe berry of Pimenta dioica, a midcanopy tree native to the Greater Antilles, southern Mexico, and Central America, now cultivated in many warm parts of the world.[2] The name allspice was coined as early as 1621 by the English, who valued it as a spice that combined the flavours of cinnamon, nutmeg, and clove.[3]
